intro: Oligactis ecuadoriensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian oligactis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at moderate elevations. Its leaves are ovate and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers display vibrant colors ranging from pink to red. Oligactis ecuadoriensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
